channel.title: Polymer Podcast
channel.description: This is a podcast about Polymer, the javascript library that provides syntactic sugar on top of web components.
channel.itunes:author: Polymer Podcast

item.title: Polymer I/O
item.description: In this episode, we talk with Taylor Savage, product manager for the Polymer Project, about the announcements at Google I/O and Polymer 1.0. We also learn about the Polymer starter kit, the new web component catalogs, and how the polymer team gets things done!
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we talk with Taylor Savage, product manager for the Polymer Project, about the announcements at Google I/O and Polymer 1.0. We also learn about the Polymer starter kit, the new web component catalogs, and how the polymer team gets things done!

item.title: History of Polymer
item.description: In this episode, we talk with Rob Dodson, developer evangelist for the Polymer Project, about the history of Polymer. We also get to to hear Rob's thoughts on the future of the web and the role Polymer will play in it.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we talk with Rob Dodson, developer evangelist for the Polymer Project, about the history of Polymer. We also get to to hear Rob's thoughts on the future of the web and the role Polymer will play in it.

item.title: Testing Polymer
item.description: We talk to Ian MacLeod, core architect behind web-component-tester about testing with Polymer. We also delve into WCT's rich history and tackle some of the harder aspects of testing.
item.itunes:summary: We talk to Ian MacLeod, core architect behind web-component-tester about testing with Polymer. We also delve into WCT's rich history and tackle some of the harder aspects of testing.
